job_title: Senior Business Analyst in Tucson, AZ
pros: Great team who helps each other.

job_title: Medical Laboratory Technician in Tucson, AZ
pros: Unlimited flexibility (or a complete lack of structure). However you want to look at it.
cons:
TMC has a reputation of unfair treatment to their employees. Very shady compensation practices. They prohibit everyone from discussing anything related to compensation. 

Per Diem employees are used as full-time employees. They will not transfer Per Diem employees to full-time even if they have been working full-time hours for a long time. They do this to avoid paying out benefits to Per Diem employees. 

Absolute lack of leadership. Suggestions and comments on areas of improvement are ignored. They assign supervisory responsibilities across all staff rather than having them be done by the supervisors. Despite the additional responsibilities, supervisors will never acknowledge your hard work and dedication. 

Supervisors do not appreciate employees. They are condescending, arrogant, and routinely act as if they are above us.

Communication is sorely lacking. I receive a response on less than half of my emails. I have attempted to address this with management multiple times and they’re response was “Communication is bad everywhere, get used to it”.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Tucson, AZ
pros: Excellent staff and occasional free lunch
cons: Management is awful. Bullying of staff. Broken and lack of equipment. No call lights in half the rooms. Working in a building that should be condemned as a health hazard.

pros: Hard working employees. Work together as a team and help each other out
cons: Hospital admin are not great. Use being a community hospital as a way for low wages.

review_title: A mess and getting paid is a night mare
pros: Over all liked lower management.

pros: Co workers were very supportive

pros: My coworkers are amazing and everyone steps in to help if they can.

review_title: I’ve never been more sexually harassed in a work environment than I have here.
job_title: Food Service Worker in Tucson, AZ
pros: The only thing that comes to mind is the benefits, they could be better but in this day and age not many people can have decent insurance.
cons: Overworked staff. Supervisors constantly threaten and belittle you. Cliquy team members and unsafe work environment. Not appreciated for hard work and dedication to the hospital many of us were born at, including myself.

review_title: This place ruined being a PCT for me
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Tucson, AZ
pros: I made slightly more money here than at previous jobs. Good coworkers.
cons:
Employee parking is confusing and terrible. TMC gives no consideration to whether there is enough, I would have to arrive 15-20 mins earlier than usual just to find a spot some days. 

PCTs might be paid a bit more than usual but I earned it. I consistently had back-breaking, unsafe patient loads. Management didn't do much to advocate for us and find more staff. 

No consideration was given to days I asked to work. Self scheduling was a myth. I was working every weekend while some techs had all of them off. 

TMC was constantly calling and begging for me to work overtime during busy times, but during slow times, I would work maybe one day a week. I was a full time, benefitted employee but for months at a time, couldn't count on being treated like one.

review_title: Check it out - great place to work!
job_title: Social Services Clinician in Tucson, AZ
pros: It's a very compassionate environment.  Co-workers work together well and I believe feel like family.  Everyone is helpful to each other and we're all there to do the best job we can for our customers - the patients.
cons: Paid time off, hospitals are 24/7, hard to juggle holidays because we have to use our own time accrued.  We earn enough hours but using them for our own holidays feels as if we don't have as much as other organic=zations.

pros: TMC has some amazing staff. The nurses I worked with were competent, helpful, and kind. The benefits were okay though adding a spouse quickly became a nightmare. Unit level management was aloof but not unkind
cons: Senior management has created a hostile working environment. Patient assignments were frequently unsafe and units were staffed too lean to assist patients. Compensation is fair to poor.

review_title: One of the best places I've worked
job_title: Staff RN in Oro Valley, AZ
pros: Non-profit, continually improving processes, well-respected in community, great management
cons: The budget is not large, due to being a non-profit. For me it's a bit of a drive.

pros: I’ve met some good people and learned a few things.
cons: I agree with another reviewer, it shocked me how my manager could flat out lie to my face. On multiple occasions. Not the type of environment I want to be in. Plus, the manager was a massive micro-manager to the point they would say what they want and then tell you exactly how to do the job you had spent the last 15 years perfecting. Also would take the keyboard from you and do it instead of letting you do your job. All of this was fine with upper mgmt, no matter how many people left that department. But worse than all of that was the massive amount of patient safety issues that would be easily enough to fix but viewed as too much of an inconvenience. So disappointing.

job_title: Operating Room Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Lots of work, overtime loved. Lots of staff are helpful and supportive. The environment is very team oriented and you will build a bond. You will get learn a lot in the medical field.
cons: Management is a problem, most of the time just do your work you will be fine. However favoritism and manipulative demands are very apparent. The work alot of times may prove too much for some especially with no experience in the field and case load.

review_title: I loved working at Tucson Medical Center because I felt like I made a difference!
job_title: Pediatrics Welcome Desk Intern in Tucson, AZ
pros: Friendly Staff. Safe Environment. New Facility. Great Employees. Helpful Nurses and Doctors.  EPIC Computer System Training. New Pediatric Wing. Clean Hospital.
cons: The job can be very boring sometimes if there are not a lot of visitors, but overall the other employees make it fun.

pros: This company feels like a family. You hate them sometimes, but you love them all the same. While day to day can get a little rough, in a time of need, your coworkers and management will back you up. Healthcare benefits just can't be beat, as well as discounts at other businesses in the area. Once your'e in the ground floor, they'll move you into almost any position you're qualified for.
cons: The management often seems distant and some departments are incredibly understaffed. Breaks are limited and the cafeteria food options are not that great.

pros: Great individuals working there, nice facility, decent pay, good location, good food, organized, good to their staff, centrally located in the Tucson area
cons: Long hours, limited days off, it was hard for me to be promoted within my field despite working there for 3 years and having a consistently good performance

pros: Good benefits, central location, some really good, intelligent people to work alongside
cons: Administration turns a deaf ear to most concerns brought up by employees and chooses to promote or give raises to people they like, not the person that works hard.  The more effort you put in the more they take advantage of you.

review_title: My experience has been great at TMC.
pros: I love working here mainly because of my co-workers. They are very compassionate and are always there to help when in need.
cons: The challenge is mainly the staff to patient ratio. This makes it difficult because we are short staffed many times and it makes it difficult to give safe patient care at times.

review_title: Financial problems affecting staff.  TMC does not value their employees
pros: Large hospital, high acuity patients offer diversity in patient population. Some facilities in the process of being upgraded such as pediatrics and OB.
cons: Financial cutbacks have affected benefits such as 401k matching, bidshift pay, and no on-call pay. High turnover rate as a result.

review_title: Great place to work in Tucson
job_title: Emergency Department RN in Tucson, AZ
pros: Busy ED that sees on average 180-200 patients per day. Pt ratio 4:1 in regular pods and 2:1 in critical pods. Not a trauma center but they are a busy ED.  Staff and management are easy to get along with.  Worked nights there and the night staff is awesome.
cons: Normal hospital politics-higher up management watching productivity but not understanding the flow of the emergency department.

pros: Pretty good pay, OK benefits. Nice co-workers and charge nurses, for the most part.
cons: High patient ratios and grinding work load.  Management looking over your shoulder for things you miss like it's not impossible to do everything.

job_title: Health Information Tech II in Tucson, AZ
pros: The overall staff is employed longer than 10 years. It seems to average at around 25 years in most departments.  The max was 30 years in my work area.
cons: The wage is under the national average for many positions. This doesn't appear to be true in the clinical positions. Areas affected the most are the non-making or no money making support areas of the hospital.

job_title: Operating Room Assistant in Tucson, AZ
pros: Decent benefits. Good co-workers. Flexible Schedule.
cons: Constant change in management. Unappreciative of support staff. Staffing never meets the work load.

job_title: Operating Room Assistant in Tucson, AZ

cons: I used to make 2$ above min wage and now that the min wage has increased they never increased my pay. I feel undervalued and taken advantage of.

job_title: Patient Care Tech in Tucson, AZ

review_title: Nice place to work before you retire.
